results.title: Solaris
results.brief_description:
A distant planet fathoms the fears and memories buried in its observer’s minds and externalises these into living beings. As a result an astronaut relives a doomed relationship with his lost wife. In the novel by Polish writer Stanislaw Lem, Tarkovsky found the elements of obsession and repetition he needed for access to his own life - science fiction as grandiloquent autobiographical text. (Adapted from a note by Patrick Strick, NFT, London). Also available on VHS.

Credits: Director, Andrei Tarkovsky ; script, Friedrich Gorenstein, Andrei Tarkovsky ; photography, Vadim Yusov ; music, Eduard Artemyev ; production designer, Mikhail Romadin ; editor, Ludmila Feganova.
Cast: Natalya Bondarchuk, Donatas Banionis, Yuri Yarvet, Nikolai Grinko, Anatoly Solonitsyn.
Note: Based on the novel by Stanislaw Lem.

results.title: Solar promise
results.creator_credit: Bullfrog Films, Henry Mayer and Tom Putnam
results.brief_description: Examines the use of solare energy for home heating. Active and passive systems are illustrated and the principles of each are outlined. A variety of homes are shown and the costs, advantages and potential for a wide range of climate conditions are fully covered. Reference is made to the indians of southwest America who understood and used passive solar heating.

results.title: Solar family
results.brief_description: The evolution of the solar system revealed according to the planetesimal hypothesis, followed by a portrayal of the real and apparent motion of the planets. Among the special phenomena presented are: the phases of Venus; retrograde motion of Mars; Jupiter and its satellites; the apparent motion of Saturn’s rings; orbits of the planetoids, Eros and Anteros; orbit of Halley’s comet; and the motion of the solar system in space.
